they're not great at picking up social cues. If you find out that your child has autism,

Things I definitely enjoyed about the show, number one:
It's fairly medically accurate, the drama in the show is interesting. It kept my attention and I wanted to see more
what would happen. I really dig the fact that it gave an inside look and into how hard
Living with autism can be, you know, you can have abusive family you have bullying
that's happening. Dealing with autism is a difficult situation, and I appreciate that the show highlights that.
I will say, however
that
they almost make him look superhuman, and that's not realistic, so that's definitely a con in my book.
